intro: Hesperaloe chiangii, commonly known as the Chiang Mai torch lily, is a striking member of the Asparagaceae family native to Thailand. It is a succulent plant characterized by its upright, spire-like stems and clusters of bright red, torch-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color, adapted to store water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping and rock gardens. Hesperaloe chiangii is prized for its ornamental value and ability to add dramatic visual interest to landscapes.
